Key Match Events: Hjulmand scored a wonder goal for Denmark in the 34th minute
Harry Kane scored for England in the 18th minute
Pre-Game Insights: George Russell of Mercedes F1 team believes England can win the tournament and praises the squad and coach Gareth Southgate
Christian Eriksen of Denmark created four chances against England, tying him with the oldest player to create four chances in consecutive European Championship games since Andrea Pirlo in 2012
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate discusses the team's performance and the decision to use Harry Kane less in the second half
Kyle Walker expresses a positive outlook on the result despite the poor performance
The Athletic writers criticize the team's performance, questioning roles and tactics

Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended with Denmark having more possession (51%) and shots (16) compared to England (49%, 12)

Denmark won twice as many tackles as England
